snippet: They've tried everything.    For the public, California officials have run a commercial that shows a motorcycle cop oblivious to the cars rocketing by him because he is so engrossed in thoughts of electricity deregulation....
lead_paragraph: They've tried everything. For the public, California officials have run a commercial that shows a motorcycle cop oblivious to the cars rocketing by him because he is so engrossed in thoughts of electricity deregulation.
abstract: California officials have not been able to get consumers excited about deregulation of electricity industry; on March 31, after three-month delay due to computer glitches, California will become first state in nation to throw market open to something close to full competition--and for last five months, marketers have inundated homes and businesses with pitches for cheaper and more efficient power delivery; so far, minuscule 25,000 customers out of 9.9 million have switched providers; most Californians remain confused about purposes of program and doubtful about payoff, if any, for them; graphs; photos (L)

headline.main: Power Deregulated. Consumers Yawn.; California's Effort to Promote Plan For Electricity Is Off to a Slow Start
